Candidate Name:	Andrew Poxon
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location: 		North Yorkshire
QUALIFICATIONS
MSc, Software Quality Engineering – Glasgow Caledonian University (1994)
BSc, Single Honours Computing Science – Stirling University (1989)
CAREER SUMMARY
2012 – Apr 2020 BTL – Salts Mill, Saltaire
Position: Quality Systems Manager
He joined BTL in March 2012. His main role in BTL has been the development of the BTL Quality Management System to ensure that it continues to provide support as BTL grows. The Quality System has nearly doubled in size, and the processes are now detailed enough to be used to support employee training and education. At the same time, the processes are generally short enough to ensure that they will actually be read.
He is particularly proud of how much people talk about the p Candidate Name:	Andrew Poxon
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location: 		North Yorkshire
QUALIFICATIONS
MSc, Software Quality Engineering – Glasgow Caledonian University (1994)
BSc, Single Honours Computing Science – Stirling University (1989)
CAREER SUMMARY
2012 – Apr 2020 BTL – Salts Mill, Saltaire
Position: Quality Systems Manager
He joined BTL in March 2012. His main role in BTL has been the development of the BTL Quality Management System to ensure that it continues to provide support as BTL grows. The Quality System has nearly doubled in size, and the processes are now detailed enough to be used to support employee training and education. At the same time, the processes are generally short enough to ensure that they will actually be read.
He is particularly proud of how much people talk about the processes the company follow and become actively involved in providing suggestions for process improvement.
He has promoted improvement throughout the organisation. Working with the teams to develop new ideas and new approaches in order to provide clear and measurable improvements.
He has developed the company Risk Register and have integrated it into the Quality system and into the audit process. The Risk register was originally developed to meet the government Management of Risk (MoR) standard. In time this has been further developed to be more practical to our needs.
He helped in the development of processes and controls to satisfy GDPR: The new European data protection policy.
He developed and expanded the Business Continuity Manual. The aim was to ensure that the company has the steps and the information to hand should a Business Continuity event occur.
He has provided support for a number of bids. This has included completing detailed client questionnaires.
In response to an increase in the number of questions he developed a document on Business Continuity and Risk so that the bid process could be supported even if he was not available.
2011 – 2012 Applied Integration – Middlesbrough
Position: Quality Manager
He joined Applied Integration as Quality Manager. This role included developing the quality systems of the company as whole as well as supporting a major defence project.
Performed audits and assessments of Applied Integrations processes and procedures ensuring that they were followed correctly and remained effective.
Identified areas of process improvement within the organization
Established a metrics collection programme so that issues and route causes can be analysed, and improvements can be measured.
Supported the initial assessment, and the development of a plan, to move the company towards SC21 certification.
Performed Test Readiness Reviews with the customer, demonstrating that the product is ready for final acceptance testing.
Performed dry runs of final acceptance testing and witnessing the customer acceptance testing of the product.
Performed assessments of suppliers and regular monitoring of their performance throughout the manufacturing process.
Assessed and inspected the products received from third party suppliers.
2008 – 2011 Digital Library Programme, The British Library (Boston Spa)
Position: Requirements Analysis Engineer (In the Digital Library Program) (Contract)
He was employed as a Requirements Analyst supporting several very complex projects that spanned a number of systems and had a diverse set of user groups.
Chaired requirement reviews with clients in order to fully identify exactly what the client actually required
Successfully introduced a mechanism for rapidly archiving “vulnerable content” within the British library. This system has now been expanded to be used on a wide range of endangered content.
Supported the introduction of Agile development within the Digital Library Program. Captured requirements as user stories, provided guidance to the engineers during the iterative development, and advised the test engineers on how the requirements could be verified.
Involved in the capture of the requirements for a wide range of differing projects, supporting those projects to completion, and release.
In a reorganization of the department a new team of Requirements Engineers was recruited. He was assigne

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
